name: overindulging
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
overindulge
[ I ] to allow yourself to have too much of something enjoyable, especially food or drink: I wish I hadn't overindulged so much last night. Some people regularly overindulge in alcohol. Synonyms
binge informal
gorge
overeat
[ T ] to allow someone to have more of something enjoyable than is good for them: Arthur obsessively tried being the opposite of his father by overindulging his eldest son. It's not good for children to be overindulged.
More examplesFewer examplesI overindulged at dinner, and now I feel sick.Planning ahead makes it less likely you'll overindulge.The director tends to overindulge in emotion-heightening excerpts of rock music.Do you overindulge your kids?71% of those who said they had been overindulged as kids reported not feeling satisfied as grown-ups.
